intro: Illecebrum aristatum, commonly known as the spiked false nettle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, sunny areas such as rocky soils and disturbed ground. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in spikes. Its stems are often hairy and can become woody at the base. Illecebrum aristatum is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
